author: James Joyce
text: Dear Miss Weaver: I hope you had a smooth passage across in spite of Patrick and are now safe and sound in the seclusion of Paris. I send you a copy of the Fortnightly. As you will see he has not bought a copy—or rather pretends he has not. His remarks are seriously meant. He ought to be informed that there is now a special cheap edition 565,423 words = 8 x 70,877 = 8 novel lengths, slightly shopsoiled, a genuine bargain going for 60 francs = 60/86 = 30/43 = about 3/4 x 20/- = 15/ ÷8 about 1/11 per normal novel suitlength real continental style—you can’t beat it for the money. A few days ago he told a reporter he had made £10,000 out of Saint Joan or was it out of old Saint Mumpledum?
